article:
This 'list of IEEE Milestones' describes the Institute of Electrical and
Electronics Engineers (IEEE) milestones, representing key historical
achievements in electrical and electronic engineering.

* Prior to 1800 ** 1751 â Book [[Experiments and Observations on Electricity]]
  by Benjamin Franklin ** 1757â1775 â Benjamin Franklin's Work in London ** 1799
  â Volta's Electrical Battery Invention

* 1800â1850 ** 1836 â Callan's Pioneering Contributions to Electrical Science
  and Technology ** 1828â1837 â Shilling's Pioneering Contribution to Practical
  Telegraphy ** 1838 â Demonstration of Practical Telegraphy

* 1850â1870 ** 1852 â Electric Fire Alarm System ** 1861â1870 â Maxwell's
  Equations ** 1861 â Transcontinental Telegraph ** 1866 â Landing of the
  Transatlantic Cable ** 1866 â County Kerry Transatlantic Cable Stations

* 1870â1890 ** 1876 â First Intelligible Voice Transmission over Electric Wire
  ** 1876 â First Distant Speech Transmission in Canada ** 1876 â Thomas Alva
  Edison Historic Site at Menlo Park ** 1882 â Vulcan Street Plant ** 1882 â
  First Central Station in South Carolina ** 1886 â Alternating Current
  Electrification (demonstrated by William Stanley, Jr.) ** 1887 â Thomas A.
  Edison West Orange Laboratories and Factories ** 1888 â Richmond Union
  Passenger Railway ** 1889 â Power System of Boston's Rapid Transit

* 1890â1900 ** 1891 â Ames Hydroelectric Generating Plant ** 1893 â Mill Creek
  No. 1 Hydroelectric Plant ** 1895 â Popov's Contribution to the Development of
  Wireless Communication ** 1895 â Adams Hydroelectric Generating Plant ** 1895
  â Marconi's Early Wireless Experiments ** 1897 â Chivilingo Hydroelectric
  Plant ** 1898 â Decew Falls Hydro-Electric Plant ** 1898 â Early Developments
  in Remote-Control (demonstrated by Nikola Tesla)

* 1900â1920 ** 1900 â Georgetown Steam Hydro Generating Plant ** 1901 â
  Transmission of Transatlantic Radio Signals ** 1901 â Reception of
  Transatlantic Radio Signals ** 1899â1902 â First Operational Use Of Wireless
  Telegraphy ** 1902 â Poulsen-Arc Radio Transmitter ** 1903 â Vucje
  Hydroelectric Plant ** 1904 â Alexanderson Radio Alternator ** 1904 â Fleming
  Valve ** 1906 â Pinawa Hydroelectric Power Project ** 1906 â First Wireless
  Radio Broadcast by Reginald A. Fessenden ** 1907 â Alternating-Current
  Electrification of the New York, New Haven & Hartford Railroad ** 1909 â
  Shoshone Transmission Line ** 1911 â Discovery of superconductivity ** 1914 â
  Panama Canal Electrical and Control Installations

* 1920â1930 ** 1920 â Westinghouse Radio Station KDKA (AM) ** 1924 â Directive
  Short Wave Antenna (Yagi-Uda antenna) ** 1924â1941 â Development of
  Electronic Television ** 1928 â One-Way Police Radio Communication ** 1929 â
  Shannon Scheme for the Electrification of the Irish Free State ** 1929 â
  Yosami Radio Transmitting Station ** 1929 â Largest Private (dc) Generating
  Plant in the U.S.A.

* 1930â1950 ** 1930â1945 â Development of Ferrite Materials and Their
  Applications ** 1933 â Two-Way Police Radio Communication ** 1934 â Long-Range
  Shortwave Voice Transmissions from Byrd's Antarctic Expedition ** 1937 â
  Westinghouse "Atom Smasher" ** 1939 â AtanasoffâBerry Computer ** 1940 â FM
  Police Radio Communication ** 1941 â Opana Radar Site ** 1939â1945 â Code-
  breaking at Bletchley Park during World War II ** 1940â1945 â MIT Radiation
  Laboratory ** 1942â1945 â US Naval Computing Machine Laboratory ** 1945 â
  Merrill Wheel-Balancing System ** 1946 â Electronic Numerical Integrator and
  Computer (ENIAC) ** 1947 â Invention of the First Transistor at Bell Telephone
  Laboratories, Inc. ** 1948 - Birthplace of the Barcode

* 1950â1960 ** 1950 â First External Cardiac Pacemaker ** 1951 â Manufacture of
  Transistors ** 1951 â Experimental Breeder Reactor I ** 1946â1953 â Monochrome-
  Compatible Electronic Color Television ** 1955 â WEIZAC Computer ** 1956 â
  RAMAC ** 1956 â The First Submarine Transatlantic Telephone Cable System (TAT-
  1) ** 1957â1958 â First Wearable Cardiac Pacemaker ** 1958 â First
  Semiconductor Integrated Circuit (IC) ** 1959 â Semiconductor Planar Process
  and Integrated Circuit

* 1960â1970 ** 1960â1984 â IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center ** 1961-1964 -
  First Optical Fiber Laser and Amplifier ** 1962 â Stanford Linear Accelerator
  Center ** 1962 â First Transatlantic Transmission of a Television Signal via
  Satellite ** 1962 â First Transatlantic Television Signal via Satellite **
  1962 â  ** 1962 â Alouette-ISIS Satellite Program ** 1963 â
  NAIC/Arecibo Radiotelescope ** 1963 â ** 1963 â Taum Sauk Pumped-Storage
  Electric Power Plant ** 1964 â Mount Fuji Radar System ** 1964 â Tokaido
  Shinkansen (Bullet Train) ** 1965 â First 735 kV AC Transmission System **
  1962â1967 â Pioneering Work on the Quartz Electronic Wristwatch ** 1968 â
  Liquid Crystal Display ** 1968 â CERN Experimental Instrumentation ** 1969 â
  Birthplace of the Internet ** 1969 â Inception of the ARPANET ** 1950â1969 â
  Electronic Technology for Space Rocket Launches ** 1969 â Electronic Quartz
  Wristwatch

* 1970âpresent ** 1965â1971 â Railroad Ticketing Examining System (developed by
  OMRON of Japan) ** 1972 â Nelson River HVDC Transmission System ** 1964â1973 â
  Pioneering Work on Electronic Calculators ** 1971â1978 â ** 1972 â Development
  of the HP-35, the First Handheld Scientific Calculator ** 1976 â Development
  of VHS, a World Standard for Home Video Recording ** 1977 â LempelâZiv Data
  Compression Algorithm ** 1978 â Speak & Spell, the First Use of a Digital
  Signal Processing IC for Speech Generation ** 1979 â Compact Disc Audio Player
  ** 1980 â International Standardization of Group 3 (Digital) Fax ** 1981 â
  Worldâs First Monolithic 16-Bit Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC) for Digital
  Audio ** 1984 â First Direct-broadcast satellite Service

* Special citations ** Nikola Tesla (1856â1943) â Electrical Pioneer
